addition.gloss: combining two or more quantities to produce a total

subtraction.gloss: finding the difference between quantities by removing one from another

multiplication.gloss: repeated addition of equal groups to produce a product

division.gloss: splitting a quantity into equal parts or groups

integer_division.gloss: division where only the whole number part of the quotient is kept

modulus.gloss: finding the remainder after dividing one integer by another

exponent.gloss: raising a base number to repeated multiplication by itself

cube.gloss: multiplying a number by itself twice

square_root.gloss: finding a number that produces a given value when multiplied by itself

cube_root.gloss: finding a number that produces a given value when cubed

absolute_value.gloss: the distance of a number from zero on the number line

negation.gloss: changing a number to its additive inverse

average.gloss: the sum of values divided by the number of values

percentage.gloss: computing a given percent of a quantity

percentage_change.gloss: measuring relative change between an old value and a new value

order_of_operations.gloss: the rule set for evaluating expressions in a consistent sequence

greater_than.gloss: a comparison showing one quantity exceeds another

less_than.gloss: a comparison showing one quantity is smaller than another

greater_or_equal.gloss: a comparison showing one quantity is greater than or equal to another

less_or_equal.gloss: a comparison showing one quantity is less than or equal to another

not_equal.gloss: a comparison showing two quantities are not the same

between_open.gloss: a compound inequality showing a value lies strictly between two bounds
between_open.exec: lambda a, x, b: a < x < b

between_closed.gloss: a compound inequality showing a value lies between or on two bounds
between_closed.exec: lambda a, x, b: a <= x <= b

absolute_value_less.gloss: an inequality showing the distance from zero is less than a bound

absolute_value_greater.gloss: an inequality showing the distance from zero is greater than a bound

equation.gloss: a statement showing that two mathematical expressions are equal

linear_equation.gloss: an equation whose graph is a straight line

two_step_equation.gloss: isolating a variable by undoing addition or subtraction and then multiplication or division
two_step_equation.exec: lambda a, b, c: (c - b) / a

solve_equation_with_parentheses.gloss: solving an equation that requires removing parentheses before isolating the variable
solve_equation_with_parentheses.exec: lambda a, b, c, d: ((d - c) / a) - b

solve_linear_two_sided.gloss: finding the value of a variable that appears on both sides of a linear equation
solve_linear_two_sided.formula: a x + b = c x + d
solve_linear_two_sided.exec: lambda a, b, c, d: (d - b) / (a - c)

solve_fractional_equation.gloss: solving an equation where the variable appears in fractional expressions on both sides
solve_fractional_equation.formula: a / x + b = c / x + d
solve_fractional_equation.exec: lambda a, b, c, d: (a - c) / (d - b)

system_two_equations.gloss: solving a system of two linear equations in two variables
system_two_equations.formula: a1 x + b1 y = c1, a2 x + b2 y = c2

quadratic_formula.gloss: the rule for solving any quadratic equation

discriminant.gloss: the expression that determines the nature of the roots of a quadratic

vertex_x.gloss: the x coordinate of the vertex of a parabola

polynomial.gloss: an expression made of variables and coefficients combined by addition and multiplication
polynomial.exec: lambda coeffs, x: sum(c * x**i for i, c in enumerate(coeffs))

sine.gloss: the ratio of the opposite side to the hypotenuse in a right triangle

cosine.gloss: the ratio of the adjacent side to the hypotenuse in a right triangle

tangent.gloss: the ratio of the opposite side to the adjacent side in a right triangle

radians_to_degrees.gloss: converting an angle from radians to degrees

degrees_to_radians.gloss: converting an angle from degrees to radians

distance_1d.gloss: the distance between two points on a line

distance_2d.gloss: the distance between two points in the plane

midpoint_2d.gloss: the point halfway between two points in the plane

slope.gloss: the rate of change between two points on a line
slope.exec: lambda x1, y1, x2, y2: (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1)

area_rectangle.gloss: the measure of space enclosed by a rectangle

area_triangle.gloss: the measure of space enclosed by a triangle

area_circle.gloss: the measure of space enclosed by a circle

pythagorean_theorem.gloss: the relationship between the legs and hypotenuse of a right triangle

volume_cube.gloss: the space contained within a cube

volume_rectangular_prism.gloss: the space contained within a rectangular box
volume_rectangular_prism.exec: lambda l, w, h: l * w * h

volume_cylinder.gloss: the space contained within a cylinder
volume_cylinder.exec: lambda math, r, h: math.pi * r**2 * h

volume_sphere.gloss: the space contained within a sphere

mean.gloss: the average value of a data set

median.gloss: the middle value of an ordered data set
median.exec: lambda values: sorted(values)[len(values)//2] if len(values)%2==1 else 0.5*(sorted(values)[len(values)//2-1] + sorted(values)[len(values)//2])

mode.gloss: the most frequently occurring value in a data set

range_stat.gloss: the difference between the largest and smallest values in a data set

variance_population.gloss: the average squared deviation from the population mean
variance_population.exec: lambda values: sum((x - (sum(values)/len(values)))**2 for x in values) / len(values)

standard_deviation_population.gloss: the square root of the population variance
standard_deviation_population.exec: lambda values: (sum((x - (sum(values)/len(values)))**2 for x in values) / len(values))**0.5

probability_event.gloss: the chance of an event occurring

probability_independent.gloss: the probability of two independent events both occurring

probability_union_disjoint.gloss: the probability that one of two mutually exclusive events occurs
